1.content:
As you pack your suitcase, you come across a picture a picture of you and Megan. As you stare at the picture, it brings a smile to your face and then tears to your eyes. You still can’t believe she’s gone.

The two of you had been dating for about a year. She was your best friend and first love. Then, she died in a car accident a few weeks ago, and your heart has been breaking over and over ever since. However, you’re even more worried about her family. Her mom, Dawn, lives with Emily, Megan’s sister. On the other hand, her dad is by himself now, since Megan lived with him. So, you’ve decided that you're going to go stay with him for a while, to keep him company. Your parents accepted your idea, happy that you were willing to help.

His name is Tony and he has always liked you. He’s usually a pretty fun, laid back guy, but ever since the accident he just hasn’t been the same. He doesn’t smile, he doesn’t laugh, and he hasn’t been to work since it happened. You’re not sure what you’re going to do yet but hopefully some company will make him feel better. With that in mind, you wipe the tears from your eyes, put the picture away, and leave your house.
1.title: I'm Sorry for your Loss

11.content:
Alex got into his car and throw his suitcase in the backseat, still a little worried about what he was going to do when he get there.

"Maybe a little music will help clear my head" he says to himself as he flips through the radio stations.

Eventually, he finds the perfect song, one of Megan’s favorites. He smiles and instinctively looked to the passenger’s seat, but his smile slowly fades to a disappointed grin as he sees that she was not there.

Sighing, he mutters, "Yeah, that figures". It was plain obvious how hard the loss was to him. He could only imagine how Megan's family must be feeling, given how Tony and Dawn were divorced. They probably felt like, if they weren't divorced, maybe things could have turned out better.

With that in mind, he then changes the channel and continues driving down the road. Right now, it was in the dead of night, well after dinner. However, he felt that Tony needed this.
11.title: Driving to Tony's

111.content:
Alex pulls up to the house and pauses for a instant before getting out of the car. He’d been there so many times that he could almost see her sitting there on the front porch waiting for him. However, after a few moments, he snaps out it and walks to the front door. He rings the doorbell but no one answers, to his surprise.

"What's up with that?" he asks himself. He then knocks on the door but still no reply. Looking around, he see's his truck so he knows he’s home. He then tries the doorknob and notices that it is unlocked.

He walks inside and can hear the TV playing in the background.

“Hey Tony, you in here?” he says, hoping for an answer. He hears someone bumping around in the living room. With that in mind, he follows the sound to see Tony sitting on the couch looking through a photo album. He doesn’t notice Alex, almost like he’s in a daze. Alex lays his stuff on the floor, and walks over to sit down beside him.

"Mr. Smith?" Alex asks as gently as he could.

Tony's eyes widen and he snaps out of it, like he was waking up from a dream. He then turns to Alex and gives as small smile.

“Oh hey Alex. I didn’t hear you come in” he says.

Alex smiles and responds, “Its cool, the door was unlocked. How you been?” He gives a weary sigh, and looks down at the pictures.

“Okay I guess. Just hanging around the house” he says. Alex then looks down at the pictures. He could tell that Megan was included extensively in these photos.

“Can I see?” he asks.

“Sure go ahead” he says as he hands the book to Alex. There were pictures of Megan when she was five or six. He smiles and laughs to himself.

"Wow, she was so cute. Where was this?” he asks, pointing to a specific picture.

"Oh, that was when we went to the mountains” he says with a smile, making Alex smile as well. It was good to see him smile again.

“What about this one?” he asks, pointing to another one

“Oh that was her eighth birthday party” he resplies, still smiling as he was going through the memories of his daughter.

“And this one?” Alex asks again. The two of them ended going through the entire book, talking and laughing. Well, Alex was laughing; Tony was smiling and occasionally chuckling to himself. It was an improvement over the more recent days.

He then turns to Alex and says, “Hey, thanks for this. I know everyone’s worried about me. I’m actually kind of worried about myself. I just can’t believe she's gone. I can’t believe that I’ll never get to see her again. I’ll never get to talk to her again.” He was acting as though he was about to cry. Then, he turned up to Alex and said, "but having you here makes me feel better. It means alot, Alex”. Alex smiles and put his hand on Tony's shoulder.

“Hey that’s what I’m here for” Alex says to him. He smiles and lets out a loud yawn.

"Man, what time is it?" he asks as Alex looks up at the clock.

"Wow, its already 12:30" Alex says.

"Well it’s been fun, but I’m going to try to get some sleep. Good night" he says as he walks to his room.

"Night" Alex says as he lays down on the couch and goes to sleep. He felt happy that he was able to make Tony feel at least a little better about the situation.

'Hopefully, there will more that I can do' he thought to himself as he fell asleep.

The places that especially felt wierd was his chest and his lower area, around the hips and rear. It was almost like he was getting bigger in some areas.

Confused, you try to respond but before you can open your mouth you wake up on the couch in the living room with a jolt.

1111121.content:
You see Tony in the kitchen, and you say "What's up?"

He looks at you and smilies. "Come and have some breakfast, Alex. In honor of you being here I've made Megan's favorite breakfast, cheese omelets."

You like anything that reminds you of Megan. You sit down and decide not to tell him about the dream, at least for the time being.

As you begin eating, Tony says "I'm so glad that you decided you stay here for a while and keep me company. Just you being here reminds me of her. You were her favorite person in the whole world." Hearing that really makes you happy.

He then says: "I just feel so bad about everything that has happened Alex. I just feel like everything is my fault."

You try to say something, but he puts a hand up and says "Please Alex, let me finish. Things were so good for a while, we where a happy family, just the four of us. But things when downhill really fast. The divorce ending up being really ugly. In the end I wanted nothing to do with Dawn and Megan, since Megan was always Dawns favorite. I got Emily in the custody hearing, she got Megan, and after that I broke all ties with either one of them. I thought I didn't need either of them in my life, and I am so ashamed to admit that."

You listen carefully, remember that when you first met Megan she was living at her mothers house.

"For the longest time, whenever Megan would mention "Her family", she was just referring to herself and Dawn, since she never saw either of me or Emily. Eventually, Dawn wanted to move to California to start over, which Megan was admittedly against. By this point I had began to feel sorry about how I treated Megan through all of this, and I wanted a second chance. Me and Dawn came to an agreement were she would get Emily and go to California, and I would stay here with Megan. The switch went without a problem. However, Megan still didn't see me as part of her family. To her, the only people in her family were herself and her mother. It was not uncommon for her to refer to the four of us as "my family, Tony and Emily". I knew it would take time but I wanted her to think of me as part of her family again and to call me Dad again. And our relationship was steadily improving, especially when you would come over. But then the accident..." he begins to trail off.

He looks sadly at you, "Listen, I didn't want anyone to know about this, but when Dawn moved to California, she went crazy. She began to neglect her responsibilities as a mother, unable to hold a steady job and spending all of her nights partying. There were rumors she was involved in heavy drug use. Then one day she went out and never came back. Police don't know what happened, but she is still missing. Emily was sent to live with Dawn's parents. I tried to get custody of her, but they refused to have anything to do with me."

Tears fall from his face as he says "Theres no hope of our family getting back together. I thought I didn't need Dawn or Megan, but I miss them more than anything right now. I just want my wife and daughter back. I would do anything to have Dawn and Megan in this house again. Anything."

"I'm sorry, I need to be alone" Tony says, as he leaves the kitchen.

Stunned of all the revelations, you do the only thing you can do: finish breakfast.

You decide to give Tony his space and spend the rest of the day at your friends house. You go back into the house later that evening and fall asleep on the couch.
1111121.title: Run into Tony

11111211.content:
Suddenly, you wake up in the middle of the night, feeling once again her touches like you did last night. Fully awake, you then feel again the weird sensations of your chest, hips and ass. However, your body has still not changed. You then hear a giggle.

Turning around, you are shocked to see Megan. Since you are not dreaming, this must be her spirit.

"Its so nice to see you again babe", she says.

"Whaa-what do you want?"

"C'mon babe, don't be afraid of me" says the spirit. "I would never hurt you in any away. I just wanted to remind you of my request last night about you taking my place"

"Please don't turn me into a girl" you plead.

She begins to laugh "Don't worry, there are limitations about what I can do as a spirit. I can only communicate with you, but I can't change you physically in any way. Those sensations were just the effects of me establishing a connection to you, not changing you in any way."

"But," she says more seriously, "I still need you to take my place. I need you to dress like me, look like me, act like me, BE me in any way possible. I want you to be me to the best of your abilities. I want Alex to go away eventually so that Megan will walk the earth."

Looking at her ghostly appearance, you say, "Megan, I love you, and I know I said I would do anything to make you happy. But leaving my life behind and start living as a girl, living as you, is too much to ask. I just can't do it."

She smirks. "You say that you can't do it now, but don't worry. I have a plan that will make you much more susceptible to the idea over time. Eventually you yourself will make the decision to live life as me and believe it is the best choice possible. You have the whole summer to get to that point. My family is going to be healed and happy again."

You start to remember what Tony said earlier. "By family, do you mean the four of you or just-"

She cuts you off. "Oh yes, when I say family I am still referring to just me and my mommy. I like Emily but I never saw her that often, and things between me and Tony are well, complicated. Perhaps if I had lived I would have thought of him as my father again, but right now I only consider my family to be me and my mommy. And soon we are going to be a family again."

"What do you mean?" you exclaim. "Your dad says your mom was missing and no one could find her. There is a good chance she is dead."

Unfazed, Megan says "Dawn, my mommy, will come back in this house. She may not be in the same body, but she is coming back, without a doubt.
And once she is back, you'll want to live as me so that I'll come back. And then Dawn and Megan, mother and daughter, the only people I consider my family, will be living in this house again."

She turns and says, "I have to go now. Don't worry, everything will become clear very soon"

Suddenly you feel tried and fall back to sleep.
11111211.title: Later that night

choices: You hear Tony's car pulling up into the driveway
You give Tony a call on his cell
111112111.content:
You wake up the next morning with a jolt. The events of last night come rushing back. Was it just another dream, or was it really an encounter with Megan's spirit. What was that stuff about you living life as her? And that you would decide to live her life by your own free will? And that her mother, who most likely is dead, will be coming back into the house? Its just too far off to be anything but a dream. Then why does it feel so real?

You shower, get dressed and head downstairs. You call for Tony but there is no answer. You check the driveway and don't see his car, so he must have run an errand. You eat some cereal and decide to go for a walk.

As you finish your walk, you notice something you didn't see before. The trash cans appear to be bulging. You open them and see that Tony as thrown away some of his personal items. You see inside the cans weightlifting equipment, sports memorabilia, old Playboys, and MMA videos, among others.
Why would Tony get rid of this stuff. He always loved his "guy toys" and always talked about one day having a man cave with all this stuff in it.

He's still not home, so you decide to see if anything in the rest of the house has changed. You go into the living room and you see that on the main bookcase, which had photos of Tony and Megan displayed, has now had all of the pictures of Tony removed and replaced with those of Dawn.

Feeling uneasy, you decide to check Tony's room upstairs. You rush in and see immediately that his closet is completely empty. Is he trying to reorganize the room, you think? Thats when you see several boxes on his bed. You remember Megan telling you that her mother left some of her stuff behind when she moved out and never came back to get it. You open the boxes and see Dawn's clothes, underwear, shoes, makeup, jewelry,
accessories, everything a woman would need. Just what is going on here?
111112111.title: The next morning

11111212.content:
Shortly after you fall asleep though, you find yourself getting up again. You try to fall back asleep but once you do you are quickly re-awoken. You realize that sleeping on this couch just isn't comfortable at all. You were able to sleep on it last night but that was only because you were so tried from the traveling. That probably explains that weird dream.

"Forget it. I can't do this." you mutter as you get up off the couch. You aren't going to be sleeping there. You need someplace else.

Then a thought occurs to you. I wonder if Megan's room still has her bed in it.

You feel a tinge of guilt at the thought of entering her room. You wonder if that would disturb her memory in some way. You assure yourself that you just going to check out her room and not do anything wrong. If her bed is still in there then that means you will be able to get a good nights sleep.

You walk upstairs into her room and turn on the light. What you see surprises you. Not only is her bed still in her room, but everything else of hers as well. Everything is like the way it was on the day she died. You figured that Tony didn't have the heart to put any of her things away. Strange, you think, if someone looked at this room they'd assume she was still alive.

Remembering what you came in for, you climb on the bed and tuck yourself in. Oh yes, this bed is so much better than the couch, you realize. Soon you are asleep.
11111212.title: You have trouble falling asleep

111112121.content:
You wake up the next morning having a restful nights sleep. That bed was a lifesaver. You look around Megan's room, once again realizing that everything of hers was still in the room. "Its like she's still around" you say to yourself.

You don't hear Tony anywhere. Good. That would save you from having to explain why you are in his dead daughters room. You go downstairs to get something for breakfast.

You get a bagel and put in the toaster. As you wait for it, you hear Tony coming down the stairs.

You turn around and see him carrying two large suitcases.

"Hey Tony" you say.

"Hey Alex. Look, I know you just got here, but I going to be leaving for about the next week or so. After talking with you last night I realize that I really just need some time away from this house. So I'm going to be taking a mini vacation up north. And before you ask, I feel that I do have to go alone. I need to figure some stuff out and I can't do it from here."

Surprised, you say "Are you leaving now."

Tony nods. "Yes, its better I leave early so I don't hit any traffic on the way up north. While I'm gone, would you mind looking over the house for me?"

"Sure Tony. Its no problem."

"Thanks Alex. I really appreciate it. If there are any emergencies please call me on my cell. If not then I ask you to not call me until I get be. I really need to not have any distractions during my trip."

He turns toward the door. "Well, I need to go. Maybe when I come back we can do something together."

He closed the door and drove off in his car, leaving you all alone.
111112121.title: Breakfast

"Well, poor guy." You say to yourself. You feel bad that Tony feels like this is all his fault. You know he's a decent guy who made some mistakes. You hope this trip will help him find some piece.

You eat your bagel and walk out of the kitchen. You realize that you are still in the same clothes you arrived in. Its definitely time to change.

You look around for your suitcase but cannot seem to find it. That's when it hits you. You didn't bring a suitcase at all when you came down here! You guess you had been so busy thinking about Megan and Tony you completely forgot you bring clothes for your say! Cursing your stupidity, you realize you will have to drive back to your parents house and pack for the stay.

You take the tedious take back to your parents house and find that their car is no longer in the driveway. You try to open the door and its locked. Crap! You could open it if you had your house key, but your parents wanted you to leave it at home so you wouldn't be there during the summer.

Well, maybe its okay. Maybe they'll be coming home soon?

You suddenly receive a text on your cell phone. It reads:

Hi honey. With you gone we've decided to go on a impromptu vacation for Vegas. Be gone for about a week. Don't go to the house it will be locked. Love you.

-Mom and Dad

Damn it! Was everyone going on impulsive trips this week. Now you have no way to get your clothes or any of your other things. What the hell to do you now.

1112.title: The next morning

11121.content:
Alex woke up a few minutes later to find himself on the bathroom floor. Slowly getting to his feet, Alex looked at the mirror to find that Megan's reflection was still looking back at him. In a state of shock, Alex raised a hand to his face; as the reflection did the exact same thing. "This can't be possible."

Bringing his hands up to his chest, praying this was all a dream, Alex was horrified when he felt Megan's firm C cup breasts in his hands. Trying to comprehend what was going on, Alex decided his best option was to go wake Tony and see if he had an explanation.

Slowly making his way to the family room, where Tony had fallen asleep on the couch, Alex walked over and started shaking Tony until he woke up. "Tony, wake up!"

Still half asleep, Tony slowly opened his eyes; only to immediately wake up when he saw what appeared to be his deceased daughter standing over him. "Me-Megan, is that you!?"

"It's me, Alex!" Pausing, Alex said, "Somehow I woke up with Megan's body."

Sitting up on the couch, Tony said, "H-How is this possible!?"

"How should I know, Tony!" starting to freak out, Alex said, "I was a guy when I went to bed last night; now I've suddenly got the body of my deceased girlfriend."

Looking at Alex, Tony said, "There's got to be an explanation for this."

"You're kidding, right?" looking at Tony, Alex said, "There's no logical explanation for why I'm suddenly a girl."

Getting up from the couch, Tony said, "I need to take a shower; perhaps that'll help me figure this out."

"Okay, great." Sitting on the couch, Alex said, "What am I supposed to do?"

"I don't know." Sighing, Tony said, "Why don't you get dressed."

As much as Alex hated to admit it, he realized that Tony was right...he'd need to get dressed sooner or later. While Tony went to take a shower, Alex slowly made his way back to Megan's bedroom to get dressed.

Once back in Megan's room, Alex closed the door and leaned against it as he thought about what to do next. There had to be a reason as to why he'd woken up in the body of his deceased girlfriend; but for the life of him he couldn't think of what it could be.

As he walked over to Megan's closet to get dressed, his vision suddenly blurred and he found himself in a white void. A quick examination showed that, to his relief, he had his male body back. Just as he was breathing a sigh of relief, he heard a voice behind him say, "Don't get too attached; this is only temporary Alex."

Turning around, in disbelief, Alex saw Megan standing in front of him. Alex didn't believe this was possible; because his girlfriend was dead...yet there she was standing in front of him. "Me-Megan, i-is that you!?"

"It's really me, Alex." Walking over, with a smile on her face, Megan said, "I guess you can say I'm an angel now."

Looking at me, Megan said, "I was afraid you'd say that."

"Yeah, you could say that." Pausing, Alex said, "Why did I look like you?"

132.title: Another Country

1322.content:
You spend the rest of the day helping him to pack his personal effects and empty out the company house. By late evening there's only one room left, the room you've both been quietly avoiding for the entire day.

But in the end there's no avoiding it...you both know what needs to be done and, without a word being spoken, you set off up the stairs together. When you push open the door to Megan's room you're surprised how serene it looks. You don't know what you'd been expecting but somehow it comes as a surprise to see everything laid out just the same as it was when you were last here. Being in this room again you can almost believe that you could turn around to see her coming through the door behind you, like nothing was wrong at all. But the only person beside you is her father.

"Ah, my poor Mei Gan" he whispers under his breath. He looks like he's only just holding back tears. "I'll do it" you say. He hesitates for a moment before nodding his approval and leaving the room. You feel like you could stand here forever, just staring back into the past. You felt like you loved her but you can hardly imagine how much worse it must be for her father. You decide that it's best just to bite the bullet, get this over with quickly.

Reluctantly you shuffle into the room, the empty cardboard box trailing from one hand. You gaze at the photos plastered on her wall, photos of her family which will never be whole again, photos of her with friends at the Southern Ridges and of course photos of the two of you together. You'd known she'd be going back home with her dad in a few months but the two of you had agreed that this was worth preserving. "We'll stay in touch" she'd said "there's the net, you can come visit me in Singapore once your year's over and, if you're feeling really romantic, you could even write me a letter!" she laughed. No letter will reach her where she is now though. You take down the photos one by one, trying not to examine them too closely.

You stack up all the papers scattered across her desk and drop them in the corner of the packing box. All the odds and ends go in there too, the accruements of a lifetime. A huge life crammed into this tiny box. Finally you go to the wardrobe and begin to load her clothes into the box, this at least, can be done quickly you think as you sweep them all up together. As you drop the bundle into the moving container you hear a dull thud as something falls out and strikes the floor.

Crouching down you realize it's a diary. Carefully opening the clasp you flick through the record of your girlfriends last year on this earth. A substantial mass of the journal is in dialect but there's some English in there too. You begin to read one of the entries made in her last few days before the accident.

You don't know why, but in that split second before he lifts his head, a single terrible impulse flashes through your mind. He's dead your thoughts silently scream before they can be rebuked. But no, he opens his eyes again to stare into yours.

"Ah, sorry I must have dozed off" he says, blinking slowly in the evening light. His gaze drifts down to the box in your arms. "So that's it?" he asks. "Yep, last box" you reply. He pulls himself up from the chair and takes the final box from your arms. Together you walk to the back of the moving truck in silence before he slides those last remnants of his daughter’s life into the back amongst the property of the living.

"Well, thanks for everything" he says "I really mean that, my...my daughter" he pauses for a moment, slowly searching his mind for the right words "I know that my daughter was very lonely here before you came along. I want to thank you for everything you did”. He said "I didn't do anything" you murmur, not quite sure how to respond to this "I mean, it was a pleasure to be able to spend time with both of you." He smiles for a split second and the awkwardness of the moment is broken. "Well my plane leaves in a couple of hours so I'd better get on the road" he exclaims, clapping you on the shoulder "Be sure to stay in touch". You wave him off as he climbs up into the cab and starts the ignition. As the truck disappears around the corner you're left standing in front of the now deserted house feeling very alone.

Later that night you lay awake in bed reminiscing. You think back over the past two years, all the ups and downs, the joy and the pain. Once you open yourself to one memory it leads to another and then another. They flow onwards in a never-ending procession. You think that it would be easy enough to go insane on a night like this. They torture you, but at the same time a part of you doesn't want to let these memory's go, to forget even the slightest detail of Megan's life would seem to be the ultimate betrayal. Was Megan's ghost still in the house and trying to change him into her.

However, there was no need for him to have these thoughts. They were very silly thoughts. In this storyline, this universe, there are no such things as ghosts. People cannot be changed physically or mentally by supernatural forces. Everything is their decision. Nothing supernatural made Alex do what he did.

Coming to his senses, Alex begins to think again. He knew that Megan loved Cheerios. He must have saw them on the counter and they reminded him of her. So the reason he decided to eat Cheerios was so that he could feel closer to her.

Then he remembered how much he had liked them and how he wanted to have them more often. He felt really happy while he was eating them. He remembered after Megan died, he had been in a funk and couldn't seem to come out of it. Even agreeing to accompany Tony on this trip didn't fully bring him out of this mood. Eating the cereal was the first time in a while he felt truly happy.

He stopped dead in his tracks. He suddenly realized he was happy because he was doing something that Megan did instead of himself. He knew what this meant. It meant doing things that Megan would do made him happy.

He didn't know what to do with this realization. But he had to speak with someone about it.

14111111.content:
Floored by this realization, Alex runs back to the beach house. He enters the living room and goes to the kitchen were Dawn still is.

"Hi Alex," she says. "Back so soon?"

"I'm sorry," Alex pants. "But I need to talk about something."

"Sure thing Alex" as she gestures Alex to sit down next to her. "What do you want to talk about?'

"I need to talk about something personal. I came to a realization while I was walking and I don't know what to do next."

Dawn strokes Alex's forehead and says "Don't worry hun, everything will be fine. What did you come to realize right now?"

Feeling calmer by her caring nature, he says "You know today when I had Cheerios for breakfast instead of a bagel?"

Dawn nods. "I thought that was a bit strange, seeing as how much you love bagels."

Alex continues "I thought so too, but then I realized how much I enjoyed eating the Cheerios. I was happier than I had been in a long time. Then I realized that they were Megans fav breakfast food, and that by eating them I was doing something Megan would normally do instead of myself. And I could only come to one conclusion."

"And that is?"

"That for some reason doing things that Megan would do makes me happy"

Dawn pauses for a moment, then gives Alex a big hug.

Looking up at her, he says "You don't think thats weird? I've always been fine being a boy. Now I'm probably getting enjoyment out of things that Megan, a girl, would do?"

"No, no, no dear" she says, "This is all perfectly natural"

"What do you mean?"

"It doesn't take a genius to see that you two deeply cared about each other. Most love I see between two young adults is simply puppy love, sweet but not made to last. You and Megan I could see had something deeper. This was true love. I could definitely see her as soulmates, meant to get married someday. And when she died, a part of you died as well. I could see that when you arrived at the house. Inside you are yearing to be with Megan again, trying to find someway to feel close to her again. So its no surprise you wanted Cheerios today. They made you feel close to her, and when you ate them, something that Megan always did, you felt really close to her. Thats why you were so happy."

Alex felt a little better. "I can see your point, but what should I do now? Do you thing I should stop this before it gets out of hand?"

Dawn gets a puzzled look on her face. "Now why would you want to do that? Why would you stop doing something that makes you happy. No, I don't think you should stop this. In fact," she says with a grin, "I think we should take it to the other extreme."

Alex now is puzzled. "Other extreme? What do you mean?"

Dawn stands up "Think about it. You're in a place were no one really knows you as Alex. We can safely assume that everytime you do something that Megan would do you are going to feel happier since her death. So why not take it all the way? Why not spend summer doing everything that Megan would have done? Why not spend the summer being Megan?"

Alex stands up in shock. "BE Megan, are you serious?"

"I know its going to be a big change" Dawn says, "Spending the next couple of months living as a girl 24/7. But think about how good you felt when you were eating those Cheerios. What if you could feel that way all the time over the summer and not be in that funk anymore. Wouldn't that be wonderful? And don't worry, I'm fully certain that Tony and Emily will be supportive about this, as well as anyone else we tells. This is a way to feel close to Megan once again, to have her in your life again."

Alex's head was spinning. Spend summer as a girl, as Megan? This would be a big change, every part of his life would be different. On the other hand, he couldn't deny that eating like Megan made him feel better than he did in months. It would be wonderful to feel that way all the time, and to have Megan in his life for the summer, even if he had to be her.

"I'm still a bit nervous about this" Alex said, "But lets just do it and see what happens."

"Splendid!" Dawn says happily. "You won't regret this. Now we have alot of work to do today. We need to go upstairs and run you a nice girly bubble bath to put you in the mood of being feminine all the time. Megan was such a girly girl. And during the bath we'll need to shave all the nasty boy hair off your body. Megan would die before she showed any body hair! Then we'll go to one of Megan favorite salons down here, and have your hair, nails,
toes, and eyebrows done so they are exactly like Megans, and we'll even have then do a makeup makeover so that you can get used to having a girls face. Then we'll come back home and I'll dress you in one of Megans favorite outfits, including the underwear, shoes, jewelry and accessories before we introduce Tony and Emily to the new Megan!"

"Whatever needs to be done to make sure that I'm happy" Alex replies.

"Oh you will!" says Dawn. "You are going to have such a fun summer. You are going to do so many of Megan' favorite things, including shopping, salon days, girls nights out, chick flicks, sleepovers and more. And lets not forget about the formal at the end of the summer! You know how much Megan loved that! I just can imagine how beautiful you'll look in your gown! Well, lets get upstairs, run your bath and start your new girly life!"

141111212.content:
Not wanting to stop, Alex decides to go ahead and collect all of the laundry from the rooms in the house. It is quite a lot of work, but he is glad to do it. He knew that helping Dawn around the house would really have made Megan happy,

After he placed the last of the clothes in the hamper in the laundry room, he heads back to the living room. Dawn was already there with a couple of glasses of lemonade and some sandwiches.

"Thought you might be hungry after all your hard work," Dawn said. "I made some peanut butter and jelly sandwiches. They were always Megan's favorite."

"Thank you," said Alex.

"Oh don't mention it. You were a really big help with the chores. You did a great job. I'm proud of you." She begins to eat her sandwich, but as she is halfway done Alex notices the gloomy expression of her face.

"Mrs. Turner? Is everything all right?"

She looks up at him with tears in her eyes. "Oh, I'm so sorry. Its just that this was sort of me and Megan's thing. We do chores and then have lunch together. It just reminds me of her, and I just miss her so much"

Then her expression brightens a bit. "Of course our absolute favorite part happened after we finished eating. After lunch we would spend about half an hour just doing a little girl talk. Specifically, we just talked about boys."

"Boys?" Alex asked.

"Yeah, me and Megan would just talk all about boys we had seen on TV, in the magazines, out in the streets, what we liked about them, what we thought was cute about them, what we dreamed about them. Oh don't worry, I am totally devoted to my husband, before you get any thoughts. It was just innocent talk between two women. But it really was a bonding time for me and Megan. It really brought us together."

"Wow, I guess you must really miss that."

"Yes I do," said Dawn sadly. Suddenly she looked at Alex. "Hey can I ask you something?"

Not wanting Tony to not get enough sleep, eventually you decide to go up to Megan's room for the rest of the evening.

As you went up the stairs you planned to unpack, and put Megan's things in the closet so that you would have room for your own. However, once you enter your room, you decide not to do that. The room was exactly like it was the day she passed away. He didn't want to disturb it. He wanted to leave it the way it was for the time being, almost like a shrine to her memory. He decided to leave everything in the boxes for now. He then put on a pair of his pajamas, and fell asleep in her bed.
154111.title: Go back to your own house

choices: The next couple of days go by...
Skip to the first free weekend Tony has...
1541111.content:
You awake the next morning having gotten a surprisingly good nights sleep. Tony sure seemed to be in good spirits again last night, you think to yourself. I guess me being here is going to have a positive effect on him. I'm glad that I am the one who is able to bring him out of his funk. He deserves it, you think, he's a nice guy.

You get dressed for the day, making sure to put on your own shoes this time. You think again about unpacking your things, but you just can't bring yourself to disturb how her room currently is. You want to preserve her memory.

You head downstairs were Tony has waffles on the table. "Morning," he says.

"Hey Tony," you reply as you dig in.

"So listen John. Since I was out of work for so long I'm going to have to work this weekend and possibly the weekend after that in order to catch up with
everything." Tony says. "However, once I do get caught up I was thinking that maybe do some guy stuff together, like go bowling or to the football game. I can even talk my friends into you joining for our poker nights."

"Sure Tony, I'd like to hang out with you whenever you have the time. I don't know too many people around here."

"Just give it time, you'll get to know the people around here. By the way, I noticed you still haven't unpacked yet"

You shrugged and said "Yeah, I know I need to, but not just yet. I want to keep her room the way it is, you know? It's kind of like a portal to the past,
like she is still alive."

"I understand John. I don't want to force you to do anything you don't want to do. You can unpack whenever you feel ready."

"Thank you Tony. Say, you don't think that Megan's spirit is somehow still in her room, and that she was the one who made me decide to leave my things in the boxes?"

Tony finished his breakfast and stood up. "John, my boy, I know its nice to thing that our dearly departed loved ones are still floating around us somehow. But that's all it is, a thought with no evidence to back it off. I know you may want to believe that Megan caused you to feel that way. But believe me, the decision not to unpack came from no one but yourself. You are the only one responsible for the decisions that you make. I gotta go, see you tonight."

As Tony left, you realize that was a silly question. You knew that deep down inside you knew it was you only that made that decision. You feel that if spirits existed, they wouldn't work that way. And although you don't know it, in this universe you are correct about that. Spirits can't effect you mentally or physically. You will be the only one making any decisions in the future.
1541111.title: The next morning

15411111.content:
During the next couple of days you begin to fall into a routine. You get up, get dressed and have breakfast with Tony before he goes to work. After he leaves, you then begin to do some chores around the house, like washing dishes, taking out the trash, and doing laundry. Tony didn't say you needed to help out around the house, but you feel you owed it to him for allowing you to stay here, even if it was his idea. And he was thankful for the help.

Next you usually decide to explore the surrounding area. You either go for a walk, a drive or you borrow Tony's bicycle. Tony lives in a pretty good-sized town so there is quite a bit to explore. You haven't really met any new friends yet, but Tony said it would take time and not to rush it.

After that you usually have lunch, and then you watch TV, a movie, or play a video game until Tony comes home. Then you have dinner and hang out for the rest of the night before going to bed.

You are enjoying yourself. There's enough to do so that you won't get bored, and Tony's attitude is becoming more positive every day. He'll be in great shape after the summer.

A couple of days go by, and then one day you finish your chores and try to figure out what you want to do next.

On one hand, you haven't really look around too closely at Megan's room since you moved in. Sure, you sleep there, but with the exception of that you really don't spend much time there. Even when you used to come over when Megan was alive you never looked at anything in there because all of your focus was on her. Now was a chance to really see what Megan saw every day when she was alive.

On the other hand, you've been meaning to stop by the movie theater. You know one of Megan's good friends works there and you've been wanting to talk with her about Megan. Who knows, this may be someone else for you to hang out with besides Tony.
15411111.title: The next couple of days go by...

choices: a little tired; you decide to lie down on Megan's bed
hungry; you decide to go out and get a burger
154111111.content:
You really need to start to make some friends around here, seeing as you are going to be here all summer. And yet, there is some part of you that really wants to explore Megan's room in-depth right now. Eventually you figure that her friend should be there for the rest of the week, and that you can always visit her later. You walk upstairs to Megan's room.

You once again stand before her door with the stickers of her name and the dragon-riding princess. You open the door and once again you are amazed about how everything is still the same from the day she died. You are standing in a living photograph. The only thing disrupting the image is the boxes containing all of your stuff from home. You resisted unpacking because you didn't want to move any of her stuff around and disturb this memory. But now you feel that just having the boxes in the room is disturbing her memory, and you can't have that. You decide to put all of the boxes in the closet in the hallway. You don't mind having to go there to get something of yours.

With the boxes out of sight you walk back into her room. Now everything in the room belongs to Megan. And you realize that this room indeed reflected who Megan was. You first see the shirt and jeans you saw on the first night you came here. The sneakers of hers that you accidentally put on are here as well. However, the rest of her clothing was neatly organized in her closet and dresser. You remember that Megan was always into fashion and cared about her appearance, even though you always told her she would be pretty in anything. Next to her closet is her vanity. Underneath its large mirror is a table containing her various makeup and beauty items. She was always into name brands. Only the best for her skin.

Looking around the room you see several posters of pop bands and young male actors. You glance back to her dresser. On the top you see her camera. Photography was one of her passions and she always talked about going into the field in the future. Behind it was her yoga mat, and the tights she wore to her ballet classes.

You turn your attention to the bookcase next to her bed. This is where you saw her book on kittens. Looking further you see several fashion, beauty, and style magazines. You also can find a number of romance novels and books of advice for young women. But what you most notice is the large photo album.

You pick it up and look through it. In it are a number of pictures of Megan, taken in your room by what you assume is one of her friends. The pictures are all of Megan in various cute and flirty poses, some standing, some sitting on her vanity, some lying on her bed. Megan not only liked photography, she also like being photographed. Even though she wanted to go into the photography field, she also always talked out wanting to be a model due to her love of fashion. This was undoubtably an album containing her amateur modeling shots. Perhaps she was planning on taking them to an agency to make her dream come true.

As you put the album back, you feel a familiar feeling. You feel
154111111.title: Explore Megan's room

choices: A few more days go by
You hear Tony come home early
1541111111.content:
...tired. Not sleepy, exactly, but just a little under the weather. You figure it must have come from staying up late last night watching the late show. You decide to just lay down for a while. You climb onto Megan's dark blue bed, lay on your back and close your eyes for a bit.

After resting for a little bit you open your eyes and look around. You look at everything in Megan's room and are so glad you left everything the way it is. As you thought before, everything is the same from when she died. Its like she is still here. As long as the room is the way it is, her memory is still alive. That makes you really happy.

But that's when you realize something else. Megan wasn't a tomboy in anyway. Everything about this room screams girly, from her clothes to her makeup supplies, to her decorations, her books and magazines. Even the colors in the room were feminine. You are staying in a room were there wasn't anything you had in your own room back home. And the thing is...you kinda like it.

You feel there's just something...nice about looking around the room and seeing items no boy would ever own. There's something about this difference in the items that's just so...mysterious and exciting.

I mean, back home you never even though about having a room like this because the desire wasn't there. And the desire wasn't there because you were a boy and you knew boy's didn't need any of this stuff. So you never even thought about it because there was no need to.

But this time you had an excuse. You wanted to keep the room the way it was so that you could keep hear memory alive. And because you had an excuse, you felt you now where able to enjoy the feeling of being a boy staying in a room meant for a girl. You allowed yourself to take pleasure in the fact that everywhere you looked in the room was different than your room back home, as if you were staying in an alternative dimension. It was like going to another reality. You realized you were in a situation that few men ever got a chance to be in, and you took pleasure in that fact.

You sighed as you looked up at the ceiling. "I'm going to love it here."
1541111111.title: a little tired; you decide to lie down on Megan...

choices: You give Megan's modeling album another look
You go to the movie theater to find Megan's friend
15411111111.content:
A few more days passed. Tony told you that he found out he was indeed going to have to work the next weekend as well, so you were going to have to wait before you two could do any guy things. Because of all the work, he was feeling more tired when he would come home from work. Although he was happy because you were here, you felt bad he felt so tired. You hoped he would get a break soon.

Your days followed the same routine they had before, with one main difference. Each day, you would make sure to spend an hour or more in Megan's room, lying on her bed and taking in the unique feelings of being a guy in a situation were he would live in a room that only a girl would be in. You didn't have to worry about his gender identity or sexuality because you didn't actually buy the items yourself. You just happened to be in a room full of items by a chain of events not entirely in your control. It wasn't your fault that moving anything around would disrupt Megan's memory.

So because of this your worry about anything are free to enjoy being in a place completely different from your home. These new and exciting feelings soon cause you to think of the time spent in Megan's room as the best part of your day.

As the days go by in fact you begin to think of the items in the room not as Megan's items, but rather your items. Okay Megan was the one who bought the stuff and primarily used it. But Tony offered you her room to stay in, effectively making it your room for the foreseeable future. And since her items have to stay in here for now, technically they are YOUR items because they are in YOUR room. This just increases the pleasure of it all, as you realize you are now a guy staying in a girls room who owns a bunch of girly items. This is another change from your home life, and the thought of it makes you even more happy.

The next day, as you are lying on the bed taking the the enjoyment of being in the situation, you decide you want to shake things up a bit. You want to try something different.
15411111111.title: A few more days go by

154111111111.content:
You look around the room and spot the photo album that contained Megan's modeling shots. You haven't looked through the photo album since that fateful day when you first decided to really look at the room. You decide to take another look at one of her passions. You look through the pages remembering just how beautiful Megan was inside and out.

That's when an idea pops into your head. Its a thought you would have never considered in the entire life, but after the past couple of days it seems like the most exciting thing in the world. You almost can't believe what you are going to do, but the idea just seems so damn pleasant.

You turn to the beginning of the photo album and look at the first picture of Megan. It shows her standing in the middle of the room, blowing a kiss to the camera.

You then get off the bed and stand in the exact same place in the room that Megan was standing in the photo. You make sure your legs are together, you slightly bend over, you place one hand on your hip and the other in front of you with your palm out, and you blow a kiss exactly like Megan did.

A tingle begins to run all over your body as you fully realize what you have done. You have just stood in the exact spot Megan once stood in, posing in the exact same way Megan once did. Not only are you using her room as your own and having it full of her things, but now you have just performed an action that Megan once did herself. You took Megan's place in that moment, and it gives you a feeling unlike any you have had before.

You need more of his. You look at the next picture in the album. You go to her vanity chair and sit down. You make sure to have your legs crossed as you place one hand on your knee. You then take the other hand and use it to place one finger on your cheek, while you put your mouth in an "o" shape and look slightly upwards. Just like Megan did in that photo.

You look at the next photo. This time she was laying on her bed. You get one of her magazines and lie down on her bed on your stomach towards the foot of the bed, away from the pillows. You then bring your legs up at the knees and cross your ankles over your butt, while pretending to read the magazine. Again, exactly like Megan.

You go through each and every photo in Megan's album. You make sure that for each photo you are in the exact same part of the room she was in, doing the exact same pose she was doing. Hours pass by but you are so into all of this you barely notice.

You finish recreating the final pose. By this point you are breathing heavily. The realization that you were doing something EXACTLY the way Megan did it gives you a rush beyond anything you have experienced in your life. Its almost a high, almost. Simply put, it is an eutrophic feeling, and you just want to start all over again.

Then you realize how much time has passed and that Tony will be home any minute now. You quickly put the album back on the shelf and go downstairs.

Poor Tony is so exhausted from all of the overtime that he just goes straight to bed after dinner. You hope he can get a free weekend soon.

A couple hours later you decide to go to bed yourself. As you get into bed you see the album and remember the delicious feelings you had earlier.

Suddenly without warning you give a girly giggle. Wow. Where did that come from you wonder?

But then you put your worries aside. This was not an unusual occurrence. You were remembering the girly modeling you did today, and you decided to choose an appropriate girly response. Again, everything you do is done my your choice. You giggle again, this time deciding to enjoy the feelings it gives you.
154111111111.title: You give Megan's modeling album another look

1541111111111.content:
The next morning you and Tony are enjoying an oatmeal breakfast. During breakfast Tony tells you how he is almost caught up with everything and that hopefully he'll have a free weekend soon. You try to sound happy for him. But all you can think about during breakfast is that you can't wait to go back upstairs and recreate all of Megan's modeling poses.

Which as soon as Tony leaves, you do. And the feeling is just as wonderful as before.

You get through half of the album and decide to take a little break to catch your breath. You put the album back on the bookcase. That's when you suddenly noticed something in her bookcase you missed before. It appears to be a little red book tucked in with the rest of her books. You pull it out and see that it has a clasp.

You open it and gasp.

It's Megan's diary.
1541111111111.title: The next day

15411111111111.content:
You hesitate. This diary contains Megan's most personal and private thoughts. Do you really have a right to read it?

But then you think: Why not?

Its not like you are a complete stranger, breaking into her room and stealing her diary. Its not even like you someone who just comes into her room periodically, like the way you were when she was alive. For the past few days you have lived in this room, essentially making it your own. This room is as much yours as it is hers. So it is different. You are entitled to read that diary as much as she was.

Still, you know that diary contains her thoughts and emotions, her hopes and dreams. Reading it could be depressing since she is no longer here. But your curiosity wins out, and you decide to read it.

This particular diary starts sometime last year and ends on the day of the car crash. As you read through it, day by day, its exactly as you suspected. Its a commentary on the last year of her life. She goes through each day in the diary. She often mentions her desires to be a model and photographer, and also mentions her love for you.
As far as the information goes there is nothing shocking. There are no major revelations or secrets of her life. Everything in the diary are things that she has told her friends, family or you before.

No, what was surprising was the way it made you feel afterwards. You were worried that reading the diary would make you really depressed that she was no longer there.
But you didn't feel depressed. Far from it, in fact. Reading that diary allowed you to get a firsthand look at Megan's thoughts and emotions during that timeframe. You were able to get a sense of how she felt and what she thought during those days. It was almost like you were able to absorb all that information into your own being, and you were able to make those thoughts and feelings your own. In a sense this was not just her diary, it was not also yours. This gave you a warm feeling almost like being on a cloud.

So many things have happened over the past couple of days that have fundamentally changed who you are as a person. You feel you need to sit down and think about all of this.
15411111111111.title: Read it

154111111111111.content:
You get off the bed and head over to the vanity. You sit down and look at your reflection in the mirror. Trying to get your thoughts together, you begin to speak to your own reflection.

"Boy, John, its amazing how life can one minute move along normally, and then without warning the world turns on its axis and nothing makes sense anymore?

I mean think about it. How did your life become so crazy in such a short period of time. Before you stayed here you were a regular guy living a regular life. And you were fine with that. But look at you now. You're staying in your old girlfriends room filled with girly things, you're sleeping in her bed, copying her modeling shots, and reading her diary like it was your own?

I'm telling you, if you keep this up you're going to end up thinking you're Megan, not John."

You look down at the table, thinking about what you just said.

Then, a though enters your head that you say out loud.

"Is that so crazy?"

You suddenly start to walk around the room, saying your thoughts out loud as they come to you.

"Is that so crazy? I mean, think about it. Here I am in Megan's room. For the past number of days I have been living here. No one else has used it, I am its sole occupant. I am the person that is using the room. This is MY room. This room, that has Megan's name on the front of the door, that contains every single thing that defined Megan when she was living, is MY room. Everything here is mine."

You begin to walk back and forth.

"But its not just that, isn't it? Its more than me taking Megan's room and making it mine. Everything I have done in this room-sleeping in her bed, wearing her shoes, copying her modeling poses, reading her diary-I have been doing exactly as Megan would have done when she was alive. These are things I would never have done as John, but Megan did them all the time."

You suddenly stop.

"Whenever I'm doing something exactly like Megan would have done, I am essentially taking her place in this world. I am basically recreating her. Whenever I do something just like her, there's a person on this earth that's acting like her again, and its almost like she's alive again."

"Don't you see, its already happened. This is my room, but its not John's room. John would never model a girls photos, but I did. John would never think of a girls diary as his own, but I did. In this room I am not John any longer."

You wait for the words to come out of your mouth.

"In this room, I am Megan."

You feel a rush of energy.

"I am Megan!"

You feel renewed. Refreshed. Reborn.

"I AM MEGAN!!!"
154111111111111.title: Continue

1541111111111111.content:
You couldn't help but giggle to yourself upon your self-proclamation of what just happened, but you couldn't help it. You really did feel like her when you were in her room. In fact, it kind of lead to a desire of wanting to see if you could do so even outside of it.

Well, in any case, the next few days flew by. While Tony was away, you kept on doing stuff in Megan's room, doing more of the same things from before, but they were never less interesting. You entertained yourself by modeling like her most of the time, while looking at parts of her diary on the side. It was funny how your mind was like a sponge, absorbing everything you read about like it should be something you should know. It felt kind of odd yet good at the same time.

Anyway, that morning, you had a usual breakfast with Tony, but there was a surprise this time. The weekend was 2 days away (today being Thursday) but he thinks that he might be able to spend some time with you then. Granted, the key word was "maybe" but that was better than nothing.

"I look forward to it," you smiled at him.

"Me too," Tony said appreciatively, giving you a small rub on the shoulder before he left again.

Once he was done, you decided to get the morning shower out of the way as usual. You went back upstairs, heading to the bathroom just across from Megan's room, the one she always used. Granted, up until now, you had still been using your own shower products, but once you got inside the bathroom, you thought of something...

"Huh....I wonder if..." you pondered.

Would it be alright to use Megan's shower products? Perhaps so, as you were already doing stuff like looking at her diary. It felt like another way to get immersed into her world, so it sounded like a good idea. As you stripped your usual clothes off though, you couldn't help but notice something as you looked into the mirror.

You...looked kind of thin. Granted, you were never buff to begin with, but here you looked a bit thinner than that. Especially around the waist. Putting your hands there, they seemed to dip just a tiny bit. Not nearly enough to say it looked like a girl's, but perhaps the beginning. You didn't seem to mind though, as it was likely just a coincidence, though it did make you recall how much you liked Megan's lithe body. There was a small other thing though. Your hair...seemed to be a bit longer now, now covering over your ears. You had blonde hair like Megan did, though this was a bit more like hers, straight with no curls or anything. You pulled at your own a bit, seeing that many knots you had were gone, straightening out.

"Huh...maybe I need a haircut soon," you shrugged as you got the shower ready.
1541111111111111.title: The next few days

15411111111111111.content:
You decide to forget about all that and focus your attention on showering with Megan's shower products. You never looked forward to a shower before, but now you feel a strange excitement about this one.

You turn on the shower, wait for it to get to the perfect temperature, and hop in. The first thing you do is wash your hair using Megan's Herbal Essences shampoo and conditioner. As you wash your hair, the floral fragrances from these products seem to engulf you in the shower, a sensation completely different from the hair products you normally use. You remember how sometimes Megan's hair would smell just like this.

Once your hair is washed you turn your attention to your body. You grab Megan's Caress Daily Silk body wash and a bath puff, and later that puff up and spread it all over your body. Lovely aromas of white peach and silk blossom enter your nostrils as the body wash begins to soften your skin. It feels completely different than the soap and water you use to wash yourself. You feel the sensation of the wash all over your body. Its a sensual experience.

You rinse yourself off and get out of the shower. You pat yourself dry using a towel. As you leave out of the shower, you can't help thinking how wonderful that shower felt. It was the best one you've had in a long time. You loved using Megan's shower products. You decide to use them from now on. You can't imagine going back to your boy shower stuff.

You go back into her room and get dressed. Now what to do next?
15411111111111111.title: Showering like Megan

154111111111111111.content:
After you got dressed in your typical clothes, you took a look at yourself.

That showed you had really made your skin feel softer, hardly anything like what it was like before. Looking at your legs beneath your shorts, they were nice and smooth now, and surprisingly no hairs now. That actually stood out to you, enough that you lifted your shirt a bit to check something. Even the little chest hair you had was gone, and you had none on your armpits either. No hair outside of what was on your head.

"Wow...nice stuff," you said with an approving nod. That stuff didn't feel necessary anyway to you.

After you were satisfied and combed your longer hair a bit, you wondered what you should do today. The day had just begun after all. You could stay in Megan's room, imaging to be her some more like you typically did these days. However, this time, you had a different thought at seeing your typical clothes. You liked acting like a girl quite a bit in here. Maybe...you should dress like one?

It was a daring thought, but with your smoother skin, perhaps it was a good one. Megan liked going to the mall, so perhaps you should spend some time there and have a good time. It didn't take much to convince you.

"Okay, sounds good," you smiled, putting your shoes on after that. "Maybe get some new shoes too..."

In any case, you got to your car, driving out and making your way down the freeway and to the nearby mall. It really only took 15 minutes or so to get down there and find a parking spot. Thankfully, there were a decent amount of spots there to choose from. Parking in one of them, you stopped the car and eventually made your way inside the mall, enjoying the feeling for once. The clothing store wasn't too far from the entrance.

It kind of felt like a new experience, with the way you were thinking right now. You had a decent amount of money. You could get yourself something nice and have a good time here. It felt kind of liberating to be honest, and it made you smile.

"Alright...so what should I look at?" you wondered.
154111111111111111.title: Go to the mall

1541111111111111111.content:
You enter the clothing store, always one of Megan's favorite places. You take a look around, wondering where to look first. You decide that the first logical step would be to buy some underwear. So you quickly head over to the lingerie section.

You walk through the racks of ladies underwear, amazed of all the different types and styles. Girls have so much more choices when it comes to underwear than guys, you think to yourself. The boxers you are currently wearing appear drab and boring in comparison. You think to yourself that you have been here in the past, but back then it was to find something nice for Megan to wear. Now you are shopping here for yourself, and whats more, you really want to buy some of these pretty things.

But something is stopping you from picking up some lovely lingerie to buy. Something just feels..off. For some reason you feel out of place. You remember back at the house thinking that this would be a good idea, but know you are not sure. What happened?

You try to think what could be causing these feelings of unease when suddenly it hits you. You realize that you want to buy girls clothes, but not as a boy. You want to buy girls clothes as a GIRL, or at lease dressed as one. Of course, the problem with that is that obviously you don't own any girls clothes, that's what you came down here in the first place.

Then suddenly you remember. DUH! How could you be so dumb? Megan as a closet full of her clothes in her room at home! You remember Tony saying how you two were the same height and had the same body type, and how her shoes fit you without any problem. You should easily be able to fit into her clothes.

You heart starts to rush as you realize what you are going to do. You are going to go back home, get dressed up in Megan's clothes, and come back here to shop as a girl!

You exit the store and are about to walk out of the mall when suddenly you stop. Even though you can't buy any clothes right now, that doesn't mean you have to leave. These mall does have some other services that you could take advantage of so that when you do go back home and get dressed, you look even more like a girl. But what to do first?
1541111111111111111.title: Looking at underwear

choices: Your chest feels a bit lumpy
15411111111111111112.content:
There were many other shops you could try out, and one such one was right near the clothing store. It was an ear piercing store, rather small, but good enough for what you needed. Megan did have pierced ears after all. Perhaps you could try some of hers once you got back to her house.

With that decided quickly, you wanted over, passing by a few people as you went inside. Nobody seemed to think oddly of you coming inside, like it was normal. Well, it helped to not make a scene after all.

Anyway, you went to the front desk, seeing a girl named Claire there. She smiled and asked what you wanted, and you plainly said that you wanted your ears pierced. Nodding in understanding, she had you wrote your name down and other standard things, like you would typically do. As usual, you wrote your name as Alex, as was typical these days. Claire nodded as she looked at the paper, saying that it wouldn't be too long. It was kind of like waiting for a haircut, just sitting in the waiting room for a little while. Thankfully, it wasn't as long.

"Okay Alex, we can take you now," Claire smiled as she waved you back.

You weren't sure what would happen, but you nodded eagerly as she took you back, sitting you down and beginning to do everything. You weren't sure what was happening, as your eyes were closed, but you did clench up a bit when you felt the pricking in your ears. Granted, the whole thing seemed to be done in a flash, allowing you to pay and get out rather quickly. You saw it in the mirror before you left, seeing the new little holes in your ears. It made you wonder how you would look with earrings.

"Thank you," you smiled at Claire, who nodded back with a smile of her own.

With that business done, you proceeded to exit, heading back to your car. As you were driving back, it did feel kind of like a waste of gas to constantly go back and forth like this, but oh well. At least you got something out of it before coming back. Arriving back at the house now, you eagerly went inside and ran up to Megan's room. It felt oddly invigorating, now seeing the idea of wearing her clothes.

"So...what should I go for?" you asked yourself.

It seemed a bit much to go for something fancy like a sundress or anything, so you laid out something casual. You got a pair of her white bra and panties, along with a pair of shorts and a tank top, all typical colors. They were simple yet nice, and you even had a pair of Megan's flip flops to go with them. Smiling, you stripped down to naked, pulling the bra and panties on.

"Wow, they're soft," you said as you felt them on you a bit.
